Submodules#

src.datastruct.camera module#

Camera data class module.

class src.datastruct.camera.Camera(name_camera: str, ppax: float, ppay: float, focal: float, width: float | None = None, height: float | None = None)[source]#

Bases: object

Shot class definition.

Parameters:

  • name_camera (str) – Name of the camera.

  • ppax (float) – Center of distortion in x.

  • ppay (float) – Center of distortion in y.

  • focal (float) – Focal of the camera.

add_dim_image(width: float, height: float) → None[source]#

Add shape of image, width height.

Parameters:

  • width (float) – Width of the image.

  • height (float) – Height of the image.

ppax: float#
ppay: float#

src.datastruct.gcp module#

Ground Control Point (GCP) class.

class src.datastruct.gcp.GCP(name_gcp: str, code: int, coor: array)[source]#

Bases: object

Ground Control Point definition.

Parameters:

  • name_gcp (str) – Name of the gcp.

  • code (int) – IGN code to differentiate between support points (1, 2, 3) and control points (11, 12, 13) 1 means precision in Z, 2 in X and Y and 3 in X, Y, Z.

  • coor (numpy.array) – Array of ground coordinate [X, Y, Z].

code: int#
coor: array#
name_gcp: str#

src.datastruct.shot module#

Acquisition data class module.

class src.datastruct.shot.Shot(name_shot: str, pos_shot: array, ori_shot: array, name_cam: str)[source]#

Bases: object

Shot class definition.

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_shot (numpy.array) – Array of coordinate position [X, Y, Z].

  • ori_shot (numpy.array) – Array of orientation of the shot [Omega, Phi, Kappa] in degree.

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

classmethod from_param_euclidean(name_shot: str, pos_eucli: array, mat_ori_eucli: array, name_cam: str, projeucli: EuclideanProj) → None[source]#

Construction of a shot object using the Euclidean position.

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_eucli (np.array) – Euclidean position of the shot.

  • mat_ori_eucli (np.array) – Euclidean rotation matrix of the shot.

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

  • projeucli (EuclideanProj) – Euclidean projection of the worksite.

Returns:

The shot.

Return type:

Shot

image_to_bundle(col: array | float, line: array | float, cam: Camera) → array[source]#

Convert coordinate image col line to coordinate bundle.

Parameters:

  • col (Union[np.array, float]) – Column coordinates of image point(s).

  • line (Union[np.array, float]) – Line coordinates of image point(s).

  • cam (Camera) – Objet cam which correspond to the shot.

Returns:

Cartographique coordinate [x,y,z].

Return type:

np.array

image_to_world(col: array | float, line: array | float, cam: Camera, projeucli: EuclideanProj, z: array | float = 0) → array[source]#

Calculate x and y cartographique coordinate with z = 0.

Parameters:

  • col (Union[np.array, float]) – Column coordinates of image point(s).

  • line (Union[np.array, float]) – Line coordinates of image point(s).

  • cam (Camera) – Objet cam which correspond to the shot.

  • proj (EuclideanProj) – Euclidean projection of the worksite.

  • z (Union[np.array, float]) – La position z du point par défault = 0.

Returns:

Cartographique coordinate [x,y,z].

Return type:

np.array

tranform_vertical(projeucli: EuclideanProj) → float[source]#

Get new z position for the acquisition. It is a height z (altitude z).

Parameters:

projeucli (EuclideanProj) – Eucliean system.

Returns:

New height z.

Return type:

float

world_to_image(x_world: array | float, y_world: array | float, z_world: array | float, cam: Camera, projeucli: EuclideanProj) → array[source]#

Calculates the c,l coordinates of a terrain point in an image.

Parameters:

  • x_world (Union[np.array, float]) – the coordinate x of ground point.

  • y_world (Union[np.array, float]) – the coordinate y of ground point.

  • z_world (Union[np.array, float]) – the coordinate z of ground point.

  • cam (Camera) – the camera used.

  • projeucli (EuclideanProj) – Euclidean projection of the worksite.

Returns:

The image coordinate [c,l].

Return type:

np.array

src.datastruct.worksite module#

Worksite data class module.

class src.datastruct.worksite.Worksite(name: str)[source]#

Bases: object

Worksite class.

add_camera(name_camera: str, ppax: float, ppay: float, focal: float) → None[source]#

Add data camera in the Worksite.

Parameters:

  • name_camera (str) – Name of the camera.

  • ppax (float) – Center of distortion in x.

  • ppay (float) – Center of distortion in y.

  • focal (float) – Focal of the camera.

add_copoint(name_point: str, name_shot: str, x: float, y: float) → None[source]#

Add linking point between acquisition in two part. One in self.copoints a dict with name_point the key and list of acquisition the result. And One in self.shot[name_shot].copoints a dict whit name_point the key and list of coordinate x (column) y (line) the result in list.

Agrs:

name_point (str): Name of the connecting point. name_shot (str): Name of the acquisition. x (float): Pixel position of the point in column. y (float): Pixel position of the point in line.

add_gcp(name_gcp: str, code_gcp: int, coor_gcp: array) → None[source]#

Add GCP in the Worksite.

Parameters:

  • name_gcp (str) – Name of the gcp.

  • code_gcp (int) – IGN code to differentiate between support points (1, 2, 3) and control points (11, 12, 13) 1 means precision in Z, 2 in X and Y and 3 in X, Y, Z.

  • coor_gcp (numpy.array) – Array of ground coordinate [X, Y, Z].

add_shot(name_shot: str, pos_shot: array, ori_shot: array, name_cam: str) → None[source]#

Add Shot to the attribut Shots.

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_shot (numpy.array) – Array of coordinate position [X, Y, Z].

  • ori_shot (numpy.array) – Array of orientation of the shot [Omega, Phi, Kappa].

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

calculate_barycentre() → array[source]#

Calculate barycentre of the worksite.

Returns:

The barycentre [X, Y, Z].

Return type:

np.array

calculate_image_world_copoints() → None[source]#

Calculates the ground position of connecting point by intersection with the most distance between two shots.

calculate_world_to_image_gcp(lcode: list) → None[source]#

Calculates the position of gcps which corresponds to the data code in the images they appear in.

Parameters:

lcode (list) – gcp code.

eucli_intersection_2p(name_copoint: str, shot1: Shot, shot2: Shot) → array[source]#

Calculates the euclidien position of a point from two shots.

Parameters:

  • name_copoint (str) – Name of copoint to calcule coordinate.

  • shot1 (Shot) – Frist shot.

  • shot2 (Shot) – Second shot.

Returns:

Euclidien coordinate of the copoint.

Return type:

np.array

known_projection(epsg: str = 'EPSG:2154', path_geotiff: str | None = None) → None[source]#

Setup a projection system to the worksite.

Parameters:

  • epsg (str) – Code epsg of the porjection ex: “EPSG:2154”.

  • path_geotiff (str) – List of GeoTIFF which represents the ellipsoid in grid form.

set_param_eucli_shots() → None[source]#

Setting up Euclidean parameters pos_shot_eucli, ori_shot_eucli, mat_rot_eucli by shot.

set_proj(epsg: str, file_epsg: str | None = None, path_geotiff: str | None = None) → None[source]#

Setup a projection system to the worksite.

Parameters:

  • epsg (str) – Code epsg of the porjection ex: “EPSG:2154”.

  • file_epsg (str) – Path to the json which list projection.

  • path_geotiff (str) – List of GeoTIFF which represents the ellipsoid in grid form.

shootings_position(add_pixel: tuple = (0, 0)) → None[source]#

Recalculates the shot’s 6 external orientation parameters, the 3 angles omega, phi, kappa and its position x, y, z. For all shot with a variation pixel.

Parameters:

add_pixel (tuple) – Factor (column, line) added on observable point.
